item.title: Quantile-Quantile Plots
item.description: Quantile-quantile plots are a useful tool for determining whether a measure is normally distributed. From Wikipedia: Qâ€“Q (quantile-quantile) plot is a probability plot, which is a graphical method for comparing two probability distributions by plotting their quantiles against each other. First, the set of intervals for the quantiles is chosen. A point (x, y) on the plot corresponds to one of the quantiles of the second distribution (y-coordinate) plotted against the same quantile of the first distribution (x-coordinate).
